author: VNExplorer
title: Storm and flood recovery stretched as heatwave hits
text:
Residents in parts of Queensland smashed by multiple extreme weather events have been warned it will take time to recover.
The state was hit by flooding, tornado-like winds and rain that claimed the lives of seven people in the days after Christmas.
Tens of thousands of homes around the Gold Coast have also endured four days without power as heatwave conditions built.
Federal Emergency Management Minister Murray Watt said some suburbs’ power networks had been “completely smashed”.
“The scale of the damage we’ve seen across a pretty big part of southeast Queensland is very large and therefore is going to take some time to work through,” Senator Watt said.
Emergency services have been stretched by flooding in Cairns and far north Queensland followed immediately by storms in the southeast.
Some suburbs’ power networks have been “completely smashed”, federal minister Murray Watt says. (JASON O’BRIEN/AAP PHOTOS)
“When you’re dealing with disasters from one end of the state to the other, literally, that is a real test for people and there’s incredible work being put in,” Senator Watt said.
Port Douglas residents and businesses were told to stop using water immediately on Friday after a landslide halted operations at a treatment plant.
Douglas Shire Council has organised collection points for bottled drinking water with a limit of two litres per person and trucks will supply non-potable water at Port Douglas Community Hall and Mossman State High School.
Acting Inspector Nick Sellars said police were attending 22 road intersections where power had been cut to traffic lights, including near the Gold Coast’s major theme parks.
Disaster Recovery Minister Nikki Boyd said five homes had been destroyed across the Gold Coast, Logan and Scenic Rim regions and 27,400 customers were without power.
Ms Boyd said 90 per cent of homes and businesses should have their power restored by New Year’s Eve and 80 SES workers were en route to assist.
Federal Nationals leader David Littleproud warned Australia was only at the start of the disaster season, casting doubt on the accuracy of weather warnings.
“We’ve got a lot of recovery to do in fixing a lot of roads, a lot of infrastructure and helping farmers out who have lost a lot of produce,” he said.
“If they haven’t provided the right warnings with the right information at the right time, then questions should be asked.”
Government Services Minister Bill Shorten said the bureau faced unpredictable circumstances in tracking Cyclone Jasper in far north Queensland.
“The Bureau of Meteorology does, on balance, a pretty good job,” he said.
“But this was just an extraordinary set of circumstances and now the focus has got to be helping people.”
Temperatures are expected to soar across most of northern Australia.
Parts of Queensland, the Northern Territory and Western Australia face extreme to severe heatwave conditions.
Marble Bar in WA’s Pilbara region may reach 49C on Saturday and temperatures up to 45C are expected there for six days.
In the Northern Territory, it’s predicted to reach 40C in Katherine and 43C in Tennant Creek, and warm minimums in Darwin are likely to make for uncomfortable nights.
Winton in Queensland’s west is expecting 43C, while up to 37C is forecast for Gympie in the storm-ravaged southeast.
Highs of up to 36C are predicted in Brisbane, while Longreach in the state’s west is forecast to get to 47C.
People in the worst impacted areas have been urged to stay indoors, close windows and blinds to keep heat out of homes and seek out fans or air-conditioners.

author: Harry Thompson
title: DJ films himself urinating on cancer patient in sick Snapchat video as cops investigate - Daily Star
text: A DJ is facing furious backlash and a [police ](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/police)probe after filming himself urinating on a cancer patient. Leigh Brookfield, 40, was playing tunes for a [wedding ](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/weddings)when he carried out the nasty act. Footage of the stunt was shared on Snapchat, which sees him appear to show fake sympathy for an older gentleman in the men's toilets. The man tells him of prostate problems he has been suffering with, about which Brookfield says he’s “sorry to hear”. But while he does this, he appears to deliberately spray urine on the man’s back while he’s not looking. READ MORE: [National Lottery winners' bonkers 2023 buys after becoming millionaires](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/national-lottery-winners-bonkers-2023-31748730) For the latest National Lottery news and results, click [here](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/national-lottery). Dyfed Powys Police in Wales have been made aware of the incident and are looking into complaints of “assault”. Brookfield performs around Llanelli, West Wales, in pubs and weddings. The DJ posted an apology on Facebook and his account has since been deleted. In it, he wrote: “I'm apologising to you all regarding my actions this evening. I'm deeply sorry for those who I have offended and if I could take it all back I would. “It's just something me and the boys do when we are drunk and until watching the video back I didn't realise that the nice gentleman next to me was going through health problems.” The apology, though, did not have the desired effect and ended up causing more uproar. One outraged social media user posted in response: “It's something you and your mates do when you are drunk? So this isn't the first time you've p

author: Newsroom Staff
title: Rogue World Music Festival comes to a close - NewsBreak
text:
By Newsroom Staff ,
13 hours ago ASHLAND, Ore. – After eight years in Ashland, the Rogue World Music Festival is no more. Rogue World Music made the announcement Thursday, saying it is stepping away from producing the festival. It says going forward, it is prioritizing other programs in the community to foster music-making. That includes... Read full article
Read in NewsBreak

author: Nouvelles
title: Un feu d'artifice sur la rivière Chicago accueillera 2025
text:
Le meilleur endroit pour la couverture de l’actualité et de la culture latine à Chicago. | Le lieu de couverture de l’actualité et de la culture latino-américaine à Chicago.
Chicago organise une célébration lumineuse et lumineuse du réveillon du Nouvel An, et tout le monde est invité.
Le feu d’artifice annuel gratuit du Nouvel An sur la rivière Chicago est prévu le 31 décembre à partir de 22 heures avec des projections « Art on the Mart » sur la façade du bâtiment Merchandise Mart, a annoncé lundi le ministère. des Affaires Culturelles et des Événements Spéciaux (DCASE).
Des feux d’artifice seront lancés à minuit depuis les ponts d’Orleans Street, La Salle Drive, Clark Street, Dearborn Street, State Street et Columbus Drive.
Les participants à l’événement sont encouragés à arriver tôt le long du Riverwalk car ils fermeront l’entrée de la zone à partir de 23 h. Pour accueillir les foules attendues, les ponts seront fermés à la circulation des véhicules et des piétons à partir de 23 h 45 jusqu’à 0 h 15. Plus des informations peuvent être trouvées sur Chicago.gov/NYE.
Les projections artistiques et audio au Merchandise Mart comprendront des installations précédentes de Jonas Denzel, Yuge Zhou, Black Dance Legacy Project, Yiyun Kang, Cory Arcangel et Brendan Fernandes.
Si vous ne pouvez pas vous rendre au Riverwalk, vous pouvez également fêter le Nouvel An avec le feu d’artifice gratuit de Navy Pier qui commence à minuit et peut être vu le long du bord du lac. Visitez NavyPier.org pour des informations complètes.
“Nous invitons les résidents et les visiteurs à se rassembler le long du Riverwalk et à célébrer la nouvelle année en célébrant ce qui fait de Chicago la ville la plus belle, la plus emblématique et la plus dynamique du monde”, a déclaré le maire Brandon Johnson dans un communiqué. .
Traduit par The Voice Chicago
#feu #dartifice #sur #rivière #Chicago #accueillera
